definition: Mongolian oak (Quercus dentata)/see also 槲樹|槲树[hu2 shu4]
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
ancient measuring vessel/fifty liters/dry measure for grain equal to five dou 五斗 (before Tang, ten pecks)
(bird species of China) mistle thrush (Turdus viscivorus)

sentences.english: In addition, clinical studies have demonstrated that Quercetin may support prostate health.
sentences.chinese: 另外，臨牀研究顯示槲黃素對前腺健康有很大貢獻。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To determine the content of quercitrin in Albizzia julibrissin Durazz.
sentences.chinese: 目的測定合歡花中槲皮苷的含量。

sentences.english: One non-exercise group received quercetin while the other did not.
sentences.chinese: 其中一組被給以槲皮素餵養，而另一組沒有。

sentences.english: RP-HPLC methods were established to determine quercetin in Vicia amoena.
sentences.chinese: 建立了坎離砂中槲皮素含量測定的高效液相色譜法。

sentences.english: Objective To explore an optimum extraction technology of rutin and quercetin from Geranium wilfordii maxim.
sentences.chinese: 目的優選出老鸛草中蘆丁和槲皮素提取最佳工藝。

sentences.english: Objective To study the optimum extraction process of quercitrin of Albizzia julibrissin Durazz.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立合歡花中槲皮苷的提取工藝。

sentences.english: Objective To establish a method for the determination of quercetin in Chuipencao capsule.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立垂盆草膠囊中槲皮素的含量測定方法。

sentences.english: The determination of the quercetin in Syringa oblata Lindl leaves were performed by high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC).
sentences.chinese: 用高效液相色譜法測定了丁香葉中槲皮素的含量。

sentences.english: This is the first report on quercetin glycoside produced by endophytic fungus.
sentences.chinese: 這是關於內生真菌產槲皮素類糖苷的首次報道。

sentences.english: The extraction technology of quercitrin urtica was studied with ethanol as extractor.
sentences.chinese: 對蕁麻中槲皮苷的乙醇提取工藝進行了研究。

definition: Chinese scholar tree (Sophora japonica)/Japanese pagoda tree
celery wormwood (Artemisia carvifolia)/to give off/to weed

Manchurian wild rice (Zizania latifolia), now rare in the wild, formerly harvested for its grain, now mainly cultivated for its edible stem known as 茭白筍[jiao1 bai2 sun3], which is swollen by a smut fungus/(variant of 菇[gu1]) mushroom
